borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
description: Construction of a two storey side extension
decision_conditions:
The proposed development, by reason of scale and siting, would result in an increased sense of overbearing to neighbouring occupiers. Specifically, it would constitute an unacceptable overbearing impact on the gardens of 86 Woodward Road, 128/130 Flamstead Road, and 103 & 105 Sheppey Road. It is therefore considered the proposal is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023);

- Policies D4 & D8 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);

- Policies BP8 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);

- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Reg 19 Submission Ver., December 2021); and

- The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012).

The proposed development, by reason of scale, siting and design, would result in unacceptable harm to the appearance of the house, the built form of the terrace, and an increased sense of closure at this corner plot, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. Therefore, the proposed development is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023);

- Policies D1/4 & HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policies CP2/3 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);

- Policies BP2/11 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);

- Policies SP2/4, SPP6 & DMD1/4/6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan (Reg 19 Submission Ver., December 2021); and

-  The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012).
